body.p:
Pittsburgh March 8th. 1865
Hon. Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir
On the 23d February I had the honor to forward an application for appointment as Commissioner for Kentucky enclosing impression of seal and five dollars.
Having received no acknowledement of the letter I was apprehensive that my letter might have miscarried as the mails have been quite irregular of late

I am Sir
Very Respectfully
John J. Mitchel

Comr Deeds
John J Mitchel
Pennsylvania
apptd
10th Mch 1865
